oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-04-23 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 23, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performer Margie Bowes, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Archie Campbell, and Del Wood. On this show, Chet Atkins presents Jim Reeves with a gold record for 1 million sales of 'He'll Have To Go'. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1072nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Margie Bowes; Del Wood; Jim Reeves
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: The Proof Is In The Puffing (Faron Young) (recording) -- Jim Reeves introduces Margie Bowes -- Jambalaya (On The Bayou) (Margie Bowes) -- Grant Turner introduces Del Wood -- Twelfth Street Rag (Del Wood) -- Chet Atkins presents Jim Reeves with a gold record -- He'll Have To Go (Jim Reeves) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Jim Reeves) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Network announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
